channel.title: Error when adding shops (508 pali source)
channel.description: I added this [code=java] case 5: shopopen(p, 868); // shop id 868 general store. generalStore = true; items = Engine.shops.MagicShop; itemsN = Engine.shops.MagicShopN; p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 64209, 93, p.items, p.itemsN);//Shop Inventory p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 64271, 31, Engine.shops.MagicShop, Engine.shops.MagicShopN);//Main Stock //set to 32 to be in playerstock p.frames.setString(p, "General Store", 620, 22); //TITLE p.frames.setString(p, "Buy and sell General things.", 620, 28); //DESC break; [/code] to shophandler.java, and then this [code=java] public int[] Pkshop = {4151, 5681, 1127, 1079, 10828, 11732, 2440, 2442, 2436, 391, 397, 385}; //Store2 public int[] PkshopN ={1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000}; // stock[/code] to shops.java, but when I compile it says this [code=java].\palidino76\rs2\io\packets\Shops.java:34: error: illegal start of expression public int[] Pkshop = {4151, 5681, 1127, 1079, 10828, 11732, 2440, 2442, 2436, 391, 397, 385}; //Store2 ^ .\palidino76\rs2\io\packets\Shops.java:35: error: illegal start of expression public int[] PkshopN ={1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1 000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000}; // stock ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/code] help please :)

item.title: Error when adding shops (508 pali source)
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:8, topic:416206”]Oh, then yes its possible. At the top add public ShopHandler shopHandler = new ShopHandler();

or whatever. I changed my base a lot and I’m not sure how pali did it :P[/quote]
Thank you very much
Respect = 100%

Edit: Oneee more error, I promise!

.\palidino76\rs2\Engine.java:30: error: <identifier> expected public shopHandler = new ShopHandler(); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Error when adding shops (508 pali source)
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

Davidi2:

Uhh, could it be ‘shops’ instead? I’m not sure what the variable name is. Check around Engine.java for the name of the variable.

Is it possible that there isn’t a variable for it yet? There weren’t any shops that came with the source… sorry I’m new to coding

item.title: Error when adding shops (508 pali source)
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

Davidi2:

But I didn’t help you yet

Yeah but it worked but I have onee more error, here it is if you aren’t busy

so in NpcOption1.java I put

case 17: // 2 (shop6-1223) Engine.shopHandler.openshop(p, 68); break;
and when I compile I get this

.\palidino76\rs2\io\packets\NPCOption1.java:60: error: cannot find symbol Engine.shopHandler.openshop(p, 68); ^ symbol: variable shopHandler location: class Engine 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
Lol sorry for being demanding

item.title: Error when adding shops (508 pali source)
item.dc:creator: @11j123 11j123
item.description:
@11j123 wrote:

I added this case 5: shopopen(p, 868); // shop id 868 general store. generalStore = true; items = Engine.shops.MagicShop; itemsN = Engine.shops.MagicShopN; p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 64209, 93, p.items, p.itemsN);//Shop Inventory p.frames.setItems(p, -1, 64271, 31, Engine.shops.MagicShop, Engine.shops.MagicShopN);//Main Stock //set to 32 to be in playerstock p.frames.setString(p, "General Store", 620, 22); //TITLE p.frames.setString(p, "Buy and sell General things.", 620, 28); //DESC break;
to shophandler.java, and then this

public int[] Pkshop = {4151, 5681, 1127, 1079, 10828, 11732, 2440, 2442, 2436, 391, 397, 385}; //Store2 public int[] PkshopN ={1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000}; // stock
to shops.java, but when I compile it says this

.\palidino76\rs2\io\packets\Shops.java:34: error: illegal start of expression public int[] Pkshop = {4151, 5681, 1127, 1079, 10828, 11732, 2440, 2442, 2436, 391, 397, 385}; //Store2 ^ .\palidino76\rs2\io\packets\Shops.java:35: error: illegal start of expression public int[] PkshopN ={1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1 000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000,1000000}; // stock ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .
help please
